poem:
**Fragile Discovery**

In rummaged refuse, his hands  
found fate's delicate veil—  
among bits of nothing,  
a deadly fragrance nestled.  
Beneath dull skies, drifted  
into danger's quiet embrace—  
life and loss, tethered  
by invisible threads, unseen.  
In the small glass bottle,  
a whisper lingered,  
unsaid, unnoticed,  
hiding death in disguise.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘Bin surfer’ may have found novichok bottle minutes after agents dumped it, inquiry hears A “bin surfer” may have found a fake perfume bottle containing a deadly nerve agent just minutes after it was discarded by agents trying to assassinate former Russian spy Sergei Skripal, a police counter-terrorism chief has said. A CCTV still, revealed for the first time at the Wiltshire poisonings inquiry, shows Charlie Rowley apparently on the hunt for valuables in charity". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.

A CCTV still, revealed for the first time at the Wiltshire poisonings inquiry, shows Charlie Rowley apparently on the hunt for valuables in charity
